channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The districts that will determine control of the House
item.description: Control of the U.S. House looks like a coin flip with Democrats and Republicans fighting over about 40 districts out of 435.

item.title: Harris calls out Trump for ‘gaslighting’ Americans about Jan. 6 attack
Can Trump and Harris turn out the voters they need? A key county has clues.
item.description: Northampton County, Pa., which went for Obama, then Trump, then Biden as part of a 100-year track record of almost always voting for the winner, shows...

item.title: Foreign Gangs Bring Our Cities Close to War
item.description: The border crisis has allowed previously unknown foreign gangs to enter the U.S. and clash with domestic gangs. To read the rest of the article click ...

item.title: Harris dismisses Trump as ‘not serious’ on the economy in MSNBC interview
item.description: It was her first solo interview with a national network as the Democratic presidential nominee.

item.title: Biden touts economic gains, acknowledges a long way to go
item.description: Interest rate cut "is not a declaration of victory, it’s a declaration of progress."

item.title: Alibaba, Baidu Invest in Chinese Smart-Driving Tech Company's Near $700 Million IPO
item.description: Alibaba and search-engine giant Baidu are investing in a nearly $700 million equity offering by Horizon Robotics.

item.title: Obama’s fears about Trump drive his stepped-up campaigning
item.description: Associates say the rallies are cathartic for the former president as he joins a Harris-Trump battle that could reflect on his own legacy.

item.title: Fed moves to protect weakening job market with bold rate cut
item.description: The move signals that the central bank is growing nervous about the declining labor market.

item.title: New drug overdose data provides hope while deaths remain too high
item.description: The Biden administration calls government data showing a significant drop in overdose drug deaths “a major, major change.”

item.title: Janet Yellen Defends Her Record – and Delivers a Warning
item.description: The Treasury secretary is defending her legacy — and warning that the stability of the U.S. economy is at stake.

item.title: There’s a Reason Harris’ Campaign Is Locked in on Quick Fixes
item.description: The Democratic nominee isn’t campaigning much on the Biden administration’s bigger, slower-moving policies.
